content:
RegularExpressionValidator Class

In this Article

Provides control capability to validate that another control's value matches a provided regular expression. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem("System.Web.UI.Design.WebControlToolboxItem, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
[System.Web.UI.ToolboxData("<{0}:RegularExpressionValidator runat="server" ErrorMessage="RegularExpressionValidator"></{0}:RegularExpressionValidator>")]
public class RegularExpressionValidator : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator

  • Object

  • MobileControl
  • TextControl
  • System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator
  • RegularExpressionValidator

Remarks

This class behaves identically to the ASP.NET System.Web.UI.WebControls.RegularExpressionValidator control.

By default, Command controls on a form raise validator controls on the form to perform validation when the form is submitted to the server. To disable automatic validation, set the CausesValidation property on the Command to false.

Constructors summary

RegularExpressionValidator()

Initializes a new instance of the RegularExpressionValidator class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Properties summary

ValidationExpression

Gets or sets the regular expression assigned to be the validation criteria. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Methods summary

CreateWebValidator()

Virtual method for derived class to create its own aggregated Web validator. The Web validator is for getting and setting of the common properties of Web base validator. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
EvaluateIsValid()

Called during the validation stage when ASP.NET processes a Web page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Constructors

  • RegularExpressionValidator()

    Initializes a new instance of the RegularExpressionValidator class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public RegularExpressionValidator ();

Properties

  • ValidationExpression

    Gets or sets the regular expression assigned to be the validation criteria. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public string ValidationExpression { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The regular expression assigned to be the validation criteria.

      The RegularExpressionValidator does not perform validation on an empty string. To test for an empty string, use the RequiredFieldValidator and RegularExpressionValidator controls together.

    Exceptions

    • HttpException

      The regular expression assigned was malformed.

    Remarks

    The following table shows some sample validation expressions:

    Type of Validation Validation Expression
    E-mail \w+([-+.]\w+)@\w+([-.]\w+)\\.\w+([-.]\w+)
    Phone number ((\(\d{3}\) ?)|(\d{3}-))?\d{3}-\d{4}
    URL http://([\w-]+\.)+[\w-]+(/[\w-./?%&=]*)?

Methods

  • CreateWebValidator()

    Virtual method for derived class to create its own aggregated Web validator. The Web validator is for getting and setting of the common properties of Web base validator. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseValidator CreateWebValidator ();

    Returns

    • BaseValidator

      An aggregated Web validator.

  • EvaluateIsValid()

    Called during the validation stage when ASP.NET processes a Web page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override bool EvaluateIsValid ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the validator is valid, otherwise, false.
